The user is experiencing an issue with downloading local LLMs in Pieces OS. The support team is investigating the issue and has requested additional information from the user.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* ThemePark reported an issue with Pieces For Desktop App not opening after the latest Pieces OS 11.0 update.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* Related issues were suggested:
    * Unable to open Pieces Core Services (#546)
    * Pieces For Desktop App no longer opens after latest Pieces OS 11.0 Release (#571)
    * Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version (#131)
* Helpful resources were provided: Existing Issues, Documentation, and YouTube Channel.
* Mack-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, reached out for more information (Windows version and confirmation of installed software).

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces For Desktop App not opening after Pieces OS 11.0 update.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* None yet, but Mack-at-pieces requested further information for investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Open issue, under investigation by the Pieces team.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS and Desktop App connection issues:** This appears to be the most common problem, impacting user experience. Focus on identifying the root cause and providing a permanent solution.
**Improve communication around updates:** The non-dismissable overlay message suggests users may be caught off guard by updates. Provide clearer messaging and instructions during the update process.
**Investigate "Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service" error:** This issue has high activity and may indicate a critical bug. Allocate resources to investigate and resolve it promptly.
**Review and update documentation:** Ensure troubleshooting steps for connection issues and other common problems are up-to-date and easy to find.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces OS and Desktop App integration:** Given the frequency of related issues, a dedicated support channel could streamline troubleshooting and information sharing.
